intro: Stachytarpheta cassiae, commonly known as blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its striking blue-violet bracts that surround small white flowers, creating a mist-like appearance. The plant belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Stachytarpheta cassiae thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil.
